title.narrative: Pilot Profiling of the Migrant Population in Cocoa Growing Regions of Cavally and Gôh

description.narrative: Many migrant workers work on cocoa plantations in the western regions of Côte d'Ivoire, particularly in Cavally and Gôh. Some are in classified forests or national parks, sometimes villages or irregular settlements. Assessments in the areas have pointed to the problem of child labour, which vulnerable families resort to due to a lack of livelihoods. In view of the Ivorian government's support to its protection policies of these green zones and the consequent plans to evict the inhabitants of these classified forests, there is a lack of detailed information on the number of occupants of the forests, the location and size of their camps, their origin, their profiles, their intentions and needs, with particular attention to children, the access to basic social services in the areas affected by the relocations, as well as a lack of information on the availability of cultivable and accessible land around the classified forests. To fill this gap, IOM proposes to provide the Government of Côte d'Ivoire with its expertise in data collection through the application of the Displacement Tracking Matrix for a pilot profiling of the migrant population in the regions.
